intro: Drypetes amazonica var. peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian drypetes, is a deciduous tree native to the Amazon rainforest and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
